Article Title: Apple has a Google Chrome warning for iPhone users
Article Text: Apple is advising iPhone users to ditch Google Chrome, citing privacy concerns. A new video from Apple parodies tracking through Chrome, highlighting how user data can be exposed despite privacy features. This comes after Google's decision to retain third-party cookies, prompting Apple to promote Safari as a more private browsing option for its users.
Article Summary: A new video from Apple parodies tracking through Chrome, highlighting how user data can be exposed despite privacy features. This comes after Google's decision to retain third-party cookies, prompting Apple to promote Safari as a more private browsing option for its users.

Article Title: Netflix CEO Ted Sarandos says company is ‘saving Hollywood’
Article Text:
What Netflix CEO said about the movie theatre experience



“What does that say? What is the consumer trying to tell us? That they’d like to watch movies at home, thank you. The studios and the theatres are duking it out over trying to preserve this 45-day window that is completely out of step with the consumer experience of just loving a movie.”

“I believe it is an outmoded idea, for most people, not for everybody.”

“We didn’t save it to save the theatre business. We saved it to save the theatre experience,”

“We have these bespoke releases … we have to do some qualification for the Oscars. They have to run for a little bit, it helps with the press cycle a little bit. But I’ve tried to encourage every director we work with to focus on the consumer, focus on the fans. Make a movie that they love, and they will reward you,”

“Folks grew up thinking, ‘I want to make movies on a gigantic screen and have strangers watch them [and to have them] play in the theatre for two months and people cry and sold-out shows … It’s an outdated concept,”

Netflix CEO Ted Sarandos has claimed that the streaming giant is "saving Hollywood." Talking at the TIME100 Summit, Sarandos said that he was asked if his company is destroying Hollywood amid issues like shrinking theatrical windows and sagging box office receipts, he said, “No, we’re saving Hollywood .” Sarandos countered these accusations by saying Netflix is “a very consumer-focused company. We deliver the program to you in a way you want to watch it.”Referring to the declining box office sales, he said:While admitting his love for theatres and their communal atmosphere, the Netflix boss noted,However, Netflix hasn’t entirely removed itself from the movie theatre business. The company owns Los Angeles’ Bay Theatre and New York’s Paris Theatre, which Sarandos says Netflix “saved” from becoming a Walgreens.he added.The company also gives certain films limited theatrical releases to qualify for awards, as with 2022’s “Glass Onion” and 2024’s “Emilia Pérez.”Sarandos noted.Sarandos said this while highlighting that Netflix is “in a period of transition.”When asked if creating films “for the communal experience” is “an outmoded idea,” he replied, “I think it is — for most people, not for everybody. If you’re fortunate to live enough in Manhattan, and you can walk to a multiplex and see a movie, that’s fantastic. Most of the country cannot.”Although he insisted he still loves movie theatres and their decline doesn’t “bother” him, Sarandos warned Hollywood not to get “trapped” behind traditional theatrical windows. Instead, he argued, studios should adapt to how audiences want to watch movies or risk losing relevance.
Article Summary: Netflix CEO Ted Sarandos has claimed that the streaming giant is "saving Hollywood" While admitting his love for theatres and their communal atmosphere, the Netflix boss noted, “I believe it is an outmoded idea, for most people, not for everybody”

Article Title: Google-Kantar report says 60% Indians are not familiar with AI
Article Text: A recent Google-Kantar report reveals a significant untapped potential for Gen AI in India, with 60% unfamiliar and only 31% having experimented. Despite low adoption, 75% desire AI as a daily growth collaborator, seeking productivity, creativity, and effective communication. Early adopters of Google's Gemini report increased confidence, productivity, and creativity.
Article Summary: A recent Google-Kantar report reveals a significant untapped potential for Gen AI in India. Despite low adoption, 75% desire AI as a daily growth collaborator. Early adopters of Google's Gemini report increased confidence, productivity, and creativity.

Article Title: Intel CFO aligns with JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon on effects of Trump tariffs
Article Text:
CEO of Intel Products says people may buy laptops with older chips

Intel Chief Financial Officer (CFO) David Zinsner has expressed concerns that President Donald Trump's tariffs and retaliatory measures from other nations have significantly increased the likelihood of an economic recession.“The very fluid trade policies in the US and beyond, as well as regulatory risks, have increased the chance of an economic slowdown, with the probability of a recession growing,” Zinsner said during the company's quarterly earnings call on Thursday (April 24).He further elaborated on the potential economic impact, saying, “The biggest risk we see is the impact of a potential pullback in investment and spending, as businesses and consumers react to higher costs and the uncertain economic backdrop.”While Intel's geographically diverse production facilities mitigate some of the direct effects of the tariffs, Zinsner acknowledged that the company “will certainly see costs increase.”Earlier this month, JP Morgan projected that the US will slip into a recession by the end of 2025, followed by Trump's reciprocal tariffs. CEO Jamie Dimon also warned that sweeping tariffs may unleash financial instability.“I think probably a recession is a likely outcome,” said Dimon, adding that recent steep market declines are deepening fears.“When you see a 2,000-point decline in the Dow, it sort of feeds on itself... it makes you feel like you're losing money in your 401(k), you're losing money in your pension. You've got to cut back,” he noted.Meanwhile, Michelle Johnston Holthaus, CEO of Intel Products, suggested that rising costs could lead consumers to favour laptops and computers utilising older, less expensive chip generations.“The macroeconomic concerns and tariffs have everybody kind of hedging their bets in what they need to have from an inventory perspective,” Holthaus said during the earnings call.In addition to tariff-related challenges, Intel is navigating US government efforts to impose licensing requirements on the shipment of advanced artificial intelligence chips to countries like China.
Article Summary: Intel CFO David Zinsner expressed concerns that President Donald Trump's tariffs and retaliatory measures from other nations have significantly increased the likelihood of an economic recession. JP Morgan projected that the US will slip into a recession by the end of 2025. CEO Jamie Dimon also warned that sweeping tariffs may unleash financial instability.

Article Title: Meghan Markle on not allowing Netflix to shoot in her house: ‘80 people in the kitchen isn’t really…’
Article Text:
What Meghan Markle said about not allowing Netflix to shoot at her house



“When people say, ‘Why didn’t you [film in] your house?’ Well, I have kids coming home for their nap, and 80 people in the kitchen isn’t really the childhood memory I’d want for them to have.”

“We were really fortunate to find something close by,”

“how I take care of myself.”

Meghan Markle has explained why she declined Netflix’s request to film “With Love, Meghan” in her own Montecito house kitchen. Instead, she had Netflix set up production in a neighbouring farmhouse reportedly owned by her friends Tom and Sherrie Cipolla. In the series, the Duchess of Sussex can be seen baking treats, planning parties, hosting brunches and guiding viewers through home-style living from the Cipollas’ California property. Markle said that by choosing a friend’s home over her private residence, she safeguarded her family’s privacy while sharing her favourite lifestyle tips on screen.During a conversation with Time CEO Jessica Sibley at the Time100 Summit in New York, Meghan explained that she didn’t allow Netflix to shoot inside her own home for her kids' privacy. She and Prince Harry, the Duke of Sussex, have two children, Archie (aged 5) and Lilibet (aged 3).Referencing the series’ huge crew, Meghan said:Meghan noted, adding that setting those boundaries for her family isAccording to a report by Page Six, the Netflix show “With Love, Meghan” was filmed at an $8 million Montecito farmhouse owned by philanthropists Tom and Sherrie Cipolla.After its March debut, the series has been approved for a second season. Production on which has already wrapped and is expected to return this fall.At the summit, Meghan even teased that World Central Kitchen founder José Andrés will make a guest appearance in Season 2.Earlier this year, she and Harry teamed up with Andrés to deliver food and supplies to victims of the devastating Los Angeles wildfires.
Article Summary: Meghan Markle has explained why she declined Netflix’s request to film “With Love, Meghan” in her own Montecito house kitchen. She had Netflix set up production in a neighbouring farmhouse reportedly owned by her friends Tom and Sherrie Cipolla.

Article Title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk calls this as 'Scam of the century'
Article Text:
OpenAI on the for-profit status

Elon Musk criticism of OpenAI’s for-profit status

Podcaster Rob Wiblin recently shared a post highlighting a legal letter titled 'Not For Private Gain', signed by 3 Nobel Prize winners and dozens of AI researchers, accusing OpenAI of illegally restructuring from a non-profit to a for-profit entity. Sent to California and Delaware Attorneys General, the letter allegedly demands halting the restructuring of the company. X owner and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk replied to the post, calling it “scam of the century”.The post also has screenshots of the letter with the following text highlighted in colour: All of the governance safeguards that Mr. Altman claimed “ensure (OpenAI) remains focused on its long-term mission would be in jeopardy”. It also has a table comparing the current governance safeguards of OpenAI (under its nonprofit structure) with the proposed changes under the for-profit restructuring.Founded in 2015 as a non-profit organization, OpenAI is reportedly looking to turn the status to for-profit. The company, as per reports plans to restructure as a public benefit corporation, a shift that has raised concerns among AI experts, legal scholars and former OpenAI employees. They argue that the move could compromise OpenAI’s original mission to develop artificial general intelligence (AGI) for the benefit of all humanity.Elon Musk, one of the co-founders of OpenAI has been a vocal critic of this transition. He has filed a lawsuit against OpenAI that will go to a jury trial in spring 2026. The lawsuit, initially dismissed, accuses OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and President Greg Brockman of deviating from its founding agreement by emphasizing profits over AI safety .
Article Summary: OpenAI is reportedly looking to turn the status to for-profit. Elon Musk, one of the co-founders of OpenAI has been a vocal critic of this transition. He has filed a lawsuit against OpenAI that will go to a jury trial in spring 2026.

Article Title: After OpenAI, Yahoo says it is ready to buy Google Chrome browser: ‘...arguably the most important strategic…’
Article Text: Yahoo has expressed interest in bidding for Google Chrome, estimating its value in the tens of billions, should a court-ordered divestiture occur due to Google's alleged search monopoly. OpenAI has also indicated interest in acquiring Chrome, highlighting its strategic importance. This testimony occurred during the remedies phase of the antitrust trial against Google.
Article Summary: Yahoo has expressed interest in bidding for Google Chrome. OpenAI has also indicated interest in acquiring Chrome. This testimony occurred during the remedies phase of the antitrust trial against Google. Google Chrome is estimated to be worth in the tens of billions.

Article Title: NYT Connections hints and answers for April 25 #684
Article Text:
Image credits: The New York Times

How to play NYT Connections

Yellow – Easy

Green – Moderate

Blue – Advanced

Purple – Master



NYT Connections hints for April 25, 2025

Image credits: The New York Times

Yellow: Chewing something, try different flavours

Green: A power push to begin

Blue: Melodies of Great America

Purple: Tyre’s traditional fluffy mate, Tyre and________



NYT Connections today answers

GUM FLAVORS

STARTING POINT

GREAT AMERICAN SONGBOOK SONGS

_____ TUBE

Image credits: The New York Times

The New York Times ' widely loved word game, Connections, is back with its April 25 edition, challenging players to test their vocabulary, logic, and pattern recognition skills. Whether you're a seasoned solver or a casual visitor, today's puzzle promises a blend of easy connections and tricky wordplay that keeps minds sharp and players hooked. Played by over 10 million people daily, Connections has become a staple for word game enthusiasts. Its addictive structure, where you group 16 words into four related sets, delivers daily “aha!” moments and mental satisfaction that make it one of the most engaging games out there.The premise of Connections is deceptively simple: you're given 16 words in a 4x4 grid and tasked with grouping them into four sets of four, based on a shared theme or hidden connection. These categories can range from types of cheeses to slang words or literary terms. But watch out—some links are subtle, and you only get four attempts to solve the puzzle before it's game over. The toughest group, marked in purple, is often reserved for the most obscure or pun-heavy connections, keeping even seasoned players on their toes.Categories are colour-coded by difficulty:Need a nudge before checking the answers? Here's what to keep in mind:bubblegumcinnamonmentholwintergreencatalystlaunchpadsparkspringboardautumn leavessummertimeunforgettablewitchcraftfallopianinnertestvacuumWith today's puzzle wrapped up, whether you breezed through it or took a few tries, Connections once again proved to be a fun and challenging way to test your word skills. See you tomorrow for more!
Article Summary: The New York Times'widely loved word game, Connections, is back with its April 25 edition. Players are given 16 words in a 4x4 grid and tasked with grouping them into four sets of four. The toughest group, marked in purple, is often reserved for the most obscure or pun-heavy connections.

Article Title: NYT Strands today: Clues, answers, Spangram for April 25, 2025
Article Text:
NYT Strands April 25, 2025 – Hints, answers, Spangram



Today's NYT Strands puzzle theme

The theme for today’s Strands is 'It’s in the stars'

Hints for today’s Strands



Hints

Hint #1: a creature from Greek mythology with the upper body of a human and the lower body a horse.

Hint #2: who was Orion in Greek mythology.

NYT Strands April 25, 2025 – Hints, answers, Spangram



Spangram for today



Constellations

Today's Strands’ answers:



SWAN

CROSS

HUNTER

DIPPER

MAIDEN

CENTAUR

What are NYT Strands and how to play the game?



Tips for solving NYT Strands puzzle



The New York Times published its inaugural crossword puzzle on February 15, 1942, in the Sunday Magazine. Created by Charles Erlenkotter and edited by Margaret Farrar, it was the first major newspaper to feature a crossword puzzle. Over the years, the NYT has introduced several beloved games, including the Mini Crossword in 2014, followed by Spelling Bee, Letter Boxed, and Tiles. In 2022, the NYT launched the wildly popular Wordle, followed by additional games like Connections and Strands.NYT Strands is the latest addition to its puzzle offerings. This engaging daily game presents players with new themes each day, challenging them to uncover all the words on the grid. One of the game’s highlights is the special Spangram, which stretches across two sides of the board. With its innovative approach to word puzzles, Strands quickly became a fan favorite, adding to the diverse and exciting puzzle lineup of the New York Times.Having trouble solving today’s NYT Strands puzzle? We’re here to help with some easy hints to fuel your curiosity even more. Plus, we’ve got today’s answer waiting for you – just keep reading.Below, we’ve shared the hints, answers, and Spangram for today’s NYT Strands puzzle. The hints may give away part or all of the Strands, so proceed with caution. Scroll down to continue:is the Spangram for today’s NYT Strands puzzle.Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Connections, Spelling Bee, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. The goal is to solve the Spangram and uncover all the theme-related words.To play, connect letters on the grid to form words by dragging your mouse or fingers (on a touchscreen) in horizontal, vertical, or diagonal directions.Start by identifying the central theme word or Spangram, which will help you understand the puzzle’s theme.In addition to the Spangram, you must also find other words related to the theme hidden in the grid. Once you’ve uncovered them all, the puzzle is complete.Identify the theme words: Fill in the grid with the theme words. Once found, they will be highlighted in blue and won't overlap with each other.Find the Spangram: Identify the Spangram, a key part of the puzzle that connects two opposite sides of the grid. It encapsulates the theme and may consist of two words. The Spangram will be highlighted in yellow once you’ve located it.Take advantage of hints: Pay attention to off-topic words for clues. For every three non-theme words you uncover, letters will be highlighted to give you a hint toward finding a theme word, without directly revealing it.
Article Summary: Strands is a puzzle game that blends elements of Spelling Bee, Connections, and classic crossword puzzles. Players are given 48 letters arranged on a 6 x 8-inch grid, along with a daily theme. One of the game’s highlights is the special Spangram, which stretches across two sides of the board.

Article Title: OpenAI introduces cost-efficient, lightweight version of ChatGPT research tool
Article Text:
ChatGPT’s lightweight deep research tool: Features and accessibility



Enhanced efficiency



OpenAI has introduced a lightweight version of its ChatGPT deep research tool , designed to provide users with cost-efficient and faster responses while maintaining the depth and quality of research. This new version is powered by OpenAI’s o4-mini model, which is optimised for reasoning and data synthesis.“The lightweight version of deep research is powered by a version of OpenAI o4-mini and is nearly as intelligent as the deep research people already know and love, while being significantly cheaper to serve. Responses will typically be shorter while maintaining the depth and quality you’ve come to expect. Once limits for the original version of deep research are reached, queries automatically default to the lightweight version,” said the company.The lightweight deep research tool is now available to ChatGPT Plus, Team, and Pro users, with plans to extend access to Enterprise and educational users next week. OpenAI has also made the tool accessible to free-tier users, offering five tasks per month. Paying users benefit from expanded usage limits , with the tool seamlessly switching to the lightweight version once limits for the original deep research are reached.While responses from the lightweight version are shorter, they retain the structured logic and citations that users expect from the original deep research tool. OpenAI claims the lightweight model is cheaper to serve, enabling broader adoption without compromising the user experience.“All Plus, Team, and Pro users now have expanded usage of deep research. Enterprise and Edu users will get access the following week, and will have the same usage levels as Team users. The lightweight version of deep research is starting to rollout today to all Free users,” added the company.
Article Summary: OpenAI has introduced a lightweight version of its ChatGPT deep research tool. This new version is powered by OpenAI’s o4-mini model, which is optimised for reasoning and data synthesis. Responses will typically be shorter while maintaining the depth and quality you’ve come to expect.

Article Title: Elon Musk replies to Vice President JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
Article Text:
Vance describes Taj Mahal as ‘Amazing’

US vice president JD Vance , accompanied by his wife Usha and their three children, toured the Taj Mahal during his recent four-day visit to India. After his visit to the historical site, Vance shared photos from his X handle, and received a reply from Elon Musk “Today I visited the Taj Mahal with Usha and the kids,” Vance said in the post on X with three photos.“It's a beautiful historic site, and I'm grateful for the warm welcome we received there!” he added.Elon Musk replied to his post, saying, “One of the most beautiful wonders of the world.”JD Vance also recorded his impressions in the visitor's diary, describing the Taj Mahal as “amazing” and a “testament to true love, human ingenuity, and a tribute to the great country of India.”The Vance family arrived at Agra airport on Wednesday (April 23), traveling from Jaipur. They were received by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, who presented them with floral greetings.The CM subsequently expressed his welcome on X, stating, “A warm welcome to Hon'ble US Vice President Mr. JD. Vance and his family to Uttar Pradesh, the sacred heartland of India, renowned for its timeless devotion, vibrant culture, and spiritual legacy.”The Vance family, including sons Ewan and Vivek and daughter Mirabel, drove from the airport to the Taj Mahal.Security measures were stringent for the visit. US security personnel had been overseeing the 12-kilometer stretch from the airport to the Taj Mahal since the previous day. The route was designated a zero-traffic zone during the family's convoy movement.The Vance family spent approximately one hour at the Taj Mahal before returning to Agra airport. Their itinerary also included a visit to the Akshardham Temple in Delhi earlier this week and also got photos clicked.
Article Summary: US vice president JD Vance visited the Taj Mahal with his wife Usha and their three children. Vance described the historical site as ‘amazing’ and a ‘testament to true love, human ingenuity, and a tribute to the great country of India’

Article Title: Bill Gates' daughter Phoebe Gates teams up with Sophia Kianni to launch free AI-powered online shopping app Phia
Article Text:
Credit: Instagram/@phoebegates

How the Phia online shopping app created by Phoebe Gates works

What Phoebe Gates and Sophia Kianni said about the app

Phoebe Gates , daughter of billionaire philanthropist Bill Gates, has joined forces with her former Stanford roommate, climate activist Sophia Kianni, to launch Phia, a groundbreaking free AI-powered shopping app . According to a report by People, Phia is set to transform online shopping by comparing prices across over 40,000 retailers and secondhand platforms, ensuring users find the best deals effortlessly. The app’s innovative features, including the “Should I Buy This?” button and personalized preferences, aim to simplify shopping while promoting sustainability. With a vast database of 250 million secondhand items, Phia promises to combine smart shopping with eco-conscious choices.Phia uses AI to compare prices across 40,000+ retail and secondhand sites, offering instant insights on whether an item is fairly priced or overpriced. Users can tap the “Should I Buy This?” button on the Phia browser extension to receive price checks and suggestions for better-priced alternatives. The app is available on iOS and as a Chrome browser extension, catering to both mobile and desktop shoppers.Phoebe Gates and Sophia Kianni, both passionate about fashion, created Phia to address the challenges of endless scrolling and manual price comparisons. “Shopping for the things you love shouldn’t be hard, expensive, or a waste of time. That’s why we built Phia—to make finding the best deal effortless,” the co-founders said in a statement to People.The app also promotes sustainability, leveraging a database of 250 million secondhand items from platforms like The RealReal, Vestiaire Collective, and Poshmark. Users can save preferences, track prices, and build collections, making Phia a personalised shopping assistant.Phia has already secured investments from notable figures, including Kris Jenner and Desiree Gruber, highlighting its potential to disrupt the e-commerce space.
Article Summary: Phia uses AI to compare prices across 40,000+ retail and secondhand sites, offering instant insights on whether an item is fairly priced or overpriced. Users can tap the “Should I Buy This?” button on the Phia browser extension to receive price checks and suggestions for better-priced alternatives. The app is available on iOS and as a Chrome browser extension.

Article Title: 9 key numbers Google CEO Sundar Pichai shared at Alphabet’s Q1 results

Article Title: ‘I’m doing the work’: Melinda Gates replies to Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos’ former wife MacKenzie Scott criticizing her…
Article Text:
When Elon Musk criticised French Melinda Gates

“I am once again asking for the scorned billionaire wife to Democrat activist pipeline to be studied.

Melinda Gates is about to spend so much divorce money on getting

elected”.

Melinda Gates, ex-wife of Microsoft founder Bill Gates has responded to criticism from top tech leaders for her philanthropic work. Melinda appeared on the Scott Galloway’s podcast recently where she spoke about how Amazon founder Jeff Bezos ’ former wife, MacKenzie Scott and Tesla CEO Elon Musk have questioned her charitable work. During the podcast, she said “I’m in the arena doing the work,” stating she is more focused on making a meaningful impact rather than engaging in debates. Melinda co-founded the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation with her ex-husband, Bill Gates. The foundation is one of the largest private charitable organizations in the world and focuses on global health, education, gender equality, and poverty reduction.Following her divorce, Melinda intensified her philanthropic efforts, with a stronger focus on issues impacting women and girls worldwide. In 2022, she announced that she would donate $1 billion over ten years through her investment and incubation company, Pivotal Ventures, to support women’s rights, reproductive health, and leadership.Recently, Melinda launched a $250 million “Action for Women’s Health” fund focused on improving women’s mental and physical health.In June last year, Musk said that French Gates’ political activities could be “the downfall of western civilization”. The Tesla CEO was replying to a post by conservative influencer Ashley St. Clair who then wroteTo this, Musk replied “Might be the downfall of western civilization”.In a related news, Melinda Gates recently opened about her divorce with Bill Gates. During an appearance on The Late Show with Stephen Colbert, the 60-year-old philanthropist explained that she had to end their 27-year-long marriage due to lack of ‘honesty’. During the interview, she said that to have a “trusted relationship, which is what I want in marriage”, “both partners have to be honest with one other”.“And if you can’t, you can’t have intimacy and you can’t have trust. And so, in the end, I had to go,” she added.
Article Summary: Melinda Gates, ex-wife of Microsoft founder Bill Gates has responded to criticism from top tech leaders for her philanthropic work. Melinda appeared on the Scott Galloway’s podcast recently where she spoke about how Amazon founder Jeff Bezos’ former wife, MacKenzie Scott and Tesla CEO Elon Musk have questioned her charitable work.

Article Title: Perplexity AI voice assistant launches on iPhone; here's how to use it
Article Text:
Perplexity AI voice assistant launches on iPhone

How to set up and use Perplexity AI voice assistant on iPhone

Update the Perplexity app : Ensure the Perplexity app is updated to the latest version available on the App Store.

: Ensure the Perplexity app is updated to the latest version available on the App Store. Grant microphone access : Allow the app to access the microphone for voice command functionality.

: Allow the app to access the microphone for voice command functionality. Activate the assistant : Tap the voice icon in the input box within the app interface to start interacting with Perplexity Assistant.

: Tap the voice icon in the input box within the app interface to start interacting with Perplexity Assistant. Save interactions : All conversations are saved as "Threads" in the app, which can be accessed through the Threads Library.

: All conversations are saved as "Threads" in the app, which can be accessed through the Threads Library. Create shortcuts: Users can add shortcuts to Perplexity Assistant on the iPhone’s home screen or lock screen for quick access.

Key features of Perplexity Assistant on iPhones

Media control:

Music and podcasts: Users can ask the assistant to play specific songs or podcasts, and Perplexity Assistant will handle the task via Apple Music, the default music and podcast app on iOS devices. While it does not support third-party music apps yet, Perplexity is reportedly working on integrating support for Gmail and Google Calendar in future updates.

Email and communication

Email management: With Perplexity Assistant, iPhone users can send emails via Apple Mail using voice commands. The assistant will also allow users to compose emails, check their inboxes, and send replies, making it a useful tool for managing communications without needing to manually type messages.

Scheduling and meetings:

Calendar integration: Perplexity Assistant can integrate with Apple Calendar, helping users review their schedules, set up meetings, and add new events to their calendar—all through voice commands. This makes it easier to stay organized and manage tasks hands-free.

Navigation and location:

Apple Maps integration: To help users find locations or get directions, Perplexity Assistant uses Apple Maps as the default navigation tool. By simply asking for an address or location, users can quickly retrieve directions or location details, making it a helpful tool when traveling or navigating unfamiliar areas.

What Perplexity Assistant cannot do

Control over system settings:

Flashlight and brightness control : The assistant cannot turn on the flashlight, adjust the screen brightness, or manage other system-level settings such as low-battery mode.

: The assistant cannot turn on the flashlight, adjust the screen brightness, or manage other system-level settings such as low-battery mode. Volume control and alarms: Users are unable to ask Perplexity Assistant to adjust the device's volume or set alarms. This is primarily due to restrictions in the Apple SDK (Software Development Kit) that prevent developers from accessing certain system functionalities for third-party apps.

Limited app integrations:

While Perplexity Assistant supports Apple’s native apps, it does not yet support third-party apps outside the Apple ecosystem (for instance, services like Gmail and Google Calendar, which Perplexity AI is working on integrating in the future). Therefore, users of such apps may find the assistant's capabilities limited for some tasks.

What’s next for Perplexity Assistant

In a major leap for iOS users, Perplexity AI has officially launched its advanced voice-activated AI tool, Perplexity Assistant, on iPhones. This new assistant is designed to enhance user convenience by managing a wide range of everyday tasks, including controlling media, setting schedules, handling emails, and providing intelligent, real-time responses. Unlike traditional AI assistants like Siri or Google Gemini, Perplexity Assistant boasts deeper integration with Apple’s native ecosystem, allowing for smoother multitasking and broader functionality. Its ability to synthesize information, provide contextual answers, and adapt to user preferences marks a significant evolution in mobile voice assistant technology for iPhone users.Perplexity Assistant distinguishes itself by its ability to perform a wide range of tasks that can be executed directly within the app. Here’s what the assistant can currently do on your iPhone:Despite the convenience it offers, Perplexity Assistant does have its limitations. Some of the key functions that the voice assistant cannot perform on iPhones include:As of now, Perplexity Assistant provides a promising set of features aimed at improving convenience for iPhone users. The app’s deep integration with Apple’s ecosystem ensures that it can handle essential tasks related to media, communication, and scheduling. However, Perplexity AI is continuously working on expanding the assistant’s capabilities.In upcoming updates, the company plans to add support for popular services like Gmail and Google Calendar, which will significantly broaden its usability. Additionally, Perplexity AI is exploring ways to bypass the limitations imposed by the Apple SDK to enable functions such as adjusting volume, controlling the flashlight, and setting alarms—all features that would make Perplexity Assistant even more functional.
Article Summary: Perplexity AI has officially launched its advanced voice-activated AI tool, Perplexity Assistant, on iPhones. This new assistant is designed to enhance user convenience by managing a wide range of everyday tasks, including controlling media, setting schedules, handling emails, and providing real-time responses.

Article Title: How China is trying to stop Apple’s ‘big’ iPhone move to India
Article Text: Apple is accelerating its iPhone production shift to India, aiming to manufacture all US-bound iPhones there by 2026 due to US tariffs on Chinese imports. This ambitious plan requires doubling India's current iPhone output.
Article Summary: Apple is aiming to manufacture all US-bound iPhones there by 2026. This ambitious plan requires doubling India's current iPhone output. Apple is accelerating its iPhone production shift to India due to U.S. tariffs on Chinese imports. The move is expected to boost iPhone sales in the United States.

Article Title: Elon Musk: Kevin O’ Leary ‘Good for him’ remark as Elon Musk’s kids count allegedly reaches 14: ‘He’s making up for the rest of…
Article Text:
Kevin O'Leary

Elon Musk’s declining population warnings

Kevin O’ Leary recently praised SpaceX CEO and owner of X for his growing family, especially the number of kids. The Shark Tank investor and entrepreneur recently appeared on Fox News where he was asked about Donald Trump administration's policy to persuade Americans to ‘have more children’. Leary started off saying “It’s interesting”, quickly jumping to Elon Musk. He said “I think Elon Musk is doing a great job, making up for the rest of all of us.” Leary further added “I think he’s on kid 14 now. Good for him”. Elon Musk has fathered thirteen children with three different women. Conservative influencer St. Ashley Clair has claimed having a son with Musk, taking his children’s count to 14. The tech billionaire has not confirmed having any child with Clair.Coming back to Leary, he shared a clip of his interview on X where he said “The reason people don't have kids earlier is they're expensive. This is kind of an issue around the cost of living and the price of education.”“So we've got a few things to fix,” he added. “We're in a very interesting situation now because people are waiting longer. What you learn in life is, when you get older you realize you wish you had your kids earlier. Family is the best thing you can get in America,” he noted.Leary also said that if he could go back in time, he would have had kids a decade earlier.Elon Musk has repeatedly made population decline warnings . Earlier this month, the Tesla CEO highlighted a historical trend where prosperous civilisations, like the Romans around 50 BC, experience population declines due to low birth rates, a pattern he sees repeating today. He claimed that Roman Empire's failure to reverse this trend.Musk response came in a reply to a post which claimed that the 3 things that is driving the change the cost-benefit of kids are:Kids no longer earn — some stay in school til they’re 30.Kids cost a lot because of inflation and college.Government pensions mean don't need kids when you’re old.
Article Summary: Kevin O' Leary recently praised SpaceX CEO and owner of X for his growing family, especially the number of kids. Elon Musk has fathered thirteen children with three different women.Leary also said that if he could go back in time, he would have had kids a decade earlier.

Article Title: Amazon Great Summer Sale 2025 starts May 1: Bank discounts, offers and what more to expect
Article Text: Amazon's Great Summer Sale 2025 commences on May 1st, offering Prime members early access at midnight. Shoppers can anticipate significant discounts across diverse categories, including electronics, fashion, and home essentials. HDFC Bank customers can avail a 10% instant discount on credit card and EMI transactions. The sale features deals on smartphones, laptops, and home appliances.
Article Summary: Amazon's Great Summer Sale 2025 commences on May 1st, offering Prime members early access at midnight. Shoppers can anticipate significant discounts across diverse categories, including electronics, fashion, and home essentials. HDFC Bank customers can avail a 10% instant discount on credit card and EMI transactions.

Article Title: Airtel rolls out international roaming plans with unlimited data
Article Text:
Airtel rolls out unlimited data plans across 189 countries

Other standout IR features include:

In-flight connectivity for uninterrupted travel.

Auto-activation of services upon landing overseas.

Auto-renewal for frequent travelers, removing the need to repurchase packs.

24x7 contact center support for quick assistance.

Plans that are more affordable than most local SIM options, eliminating the hassle of acquiring country-specific SIM cards.

A Special 1-year recharge plan for NRIs

5GB data and 100 voice minutes for use overseas.

1.5GB daily data and unlimited calls while in India.

Telecom operator Airtel has announced new international roaming plans which offer unlimited data across 189 countries, alongside a 1-year recharge plan. The company claims that the new plans are designed for the NRI community and aims to offer simpler, more affordable and hassle-free connectivity experience.The new unlimited plans rolled out by Airtel eliminate the complexities of choosing between different zones or packs and offer seamless connectivity for users across multiple transit airports or destinations. Customers can manage their roaming needs through the Airtel Thanks app , gaining real-time updates on usage, billing, and easy data or minute top-ups.To cater to long-staying NRIs, Airtel has unveiled a unique ₹4000 recharge plan with 1-year validity, allowing seamless use both abroad and in India. This plan includes:According to Siddharth Sharma, Director Marketing and CEO – Connected Homes at Airtel, the updated IR plans reflect Airtel’s commitment to simplifying customer experiences and delivering exceptional value. Sharma stated, “We’re empowering our customers to roam the world effortlessly, with data and voice generously available at competitive rates.”
Article Summary: Airtel has announced new international roaming plans which offer unlimited data across 189 countries, alongside a 1-year recharge plan. The company claims that the new plans are designed for the NRI community and aims to offer simpler, more affordable and hassle-free connectivity experience.

Article Title: Intel makes 4-day work from the office compulsory starting September 1; CEO Lip-Bu Tan says ‘I wanted to tell you well in advance that …’
Article Text:
Intel mandates four days in the office

Intel joins other tech giants

Intel has announced a new policy requiring employees to work from the office four days a week, marking a shift from its previous hybrid model that allowed two remote workdays. The change, effective September 1, 2025, was revealed during Intel’s Q1 2025 earnings call by CEO Lip-Bu Tan, who emphasised the importance of in-person collaboration. During Intel's Q1 2025 earnings call, CEO Lip-Bu Tan also outlined a strategic roadmap aimed at revitalizing the company's market position and driving sustainable growth. Reporting $12.7 billion in revenue, Intel exceeded expectations, with strong demand for its Xeon processors contributing to the results. Tan emphasized a return to fundamentals, focusing on streamlining operations, empowering engineers, and enhancing execution efficiency. The company announced plans to reduce operating expenses to $17 billion in 2025 and $16 billion in 2026.Lip-Bu Tan described the move as essential for fostering engaging discussions, faster decision-making, and stronger team connections. He stated, “Our sites need to be vibrant hubs of collaboration that reflect our culture in action.” Local leadership will work with employees to create site-specific plans for a smooth transition.“When we spend time together in person, it fosters more engaging and productive discussion and debate. It drives better and faster decision-making. And it strengthens our connection with colleagues,” added Tan.Intel will be updating its policy starting September 1. “With this in mind, our policy will be updated to require on-site presence for four days a week starting September 1. We're informing you well in advance so you can make any necessary adjustments to your daily routines. In the meantime, we will ensure that sites are fully prepared to operate at full capacity. Local leadership will provide site-specific details and gather your feedback to create the best possible on-site experience,” concluded Tan.Intel joins other tech giants like Amazon and Salesforce, which have also implemented stricter return-to-office mandates. However, research suggests that such policies may negatively impact employee satisfaction , raising questions about their long-term effectiveness.The announcement comes amid Intel’s broader efforts to streamline operations, including potential layoffs and restructuring, as the company navigates challenges in the competitive semiconductor industry.
Article Summary: Intel has announced a new policy requiring employees to work from the office four days a week. The change, effective September 1, 2025, was revealed during Intel’s Q1 2025 earnings call by CEO Lip-Bu Tan. Tan described the move as essential for fostering engaging discussions and faster decision-making.

Article Title: Meta lays off more employees in another round of job cuts, says ‘These changes are meant to…’
Article Text:
Meta layoffs: Restructuring for efficiency

Meta layoffs: Impact on Supernatural

Meta has announced layoffs within its Reality Labs division, specifically impacting teams in Oculus Studios , the unit responsible for developing apps and games for Meta’s Quest VR headsets . Among the affected projects is Supernatural, a popular VR fitness app that Meta acquired in 2023.Meta stated that the layoffs are part of a broader effort to streamline operations and focus on future mixed reality experiences . While the exact number of employees affected remains undisclosed, the company emphasized that the changes aim to help Oculus Studios work more efficiently while continuing to deliver engaging content for users.“These changes are meant to help Studios work more efficiently on future mixed reality experiences for our growing audience," a Meta spokesperson told Reuters.For Supernatural users, the layoffs mean a reduction in the number of new workout releases per week. However, Meta assured users that existing workouts will now be available at multiple skill levels, enhancing accessibility. The app’s coaches, who lead the workouts, will not be impacted by the restructuring.This move comes as Meta faces mounting pressure to reduce costs in its Reality Labs division, which reported a $5 billion operating loss in the last quarter of 2024. The layoffs also precede Meta’s upcoming earnings report, where the company is expected to face scrutiny over its investments in the metaverse.
Article Summary: Meta has announced layoffs within its Reality Labs division, specifically impacting teams in Oculus Studios. The layoffs are part of a broader effort to streamline operations and focus on future mixed reality experiences. Among the affected projects is Supernatural, a popular VR fitness app that Meta acquired in 2023.
